arm_group.description: in only one group, inspiratio to expiratio ratio 1:2 to 1:1 will be applied during pneumoperitoneum

brief_summary.textblock:
changes of inspiration: expiration ration from 1:2 to 1:1 could improve the arterial
      oxygenation and respiratory mechanics

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect Inverse Ratio Ventilation on Arterial Oxygenation and Respiratory Mechanics During lapaLAR

detailed_description.textblock:
Inverse ratio ventilation already known as effective to improve the oxygenation and
      respiratory mechanics in the ARDS patients. Recently, there were report of decrease in
      airway pressure and improve in respiratory compliance during inverse ration ventilation
      undergoing one lung ventilation. We hypothized that changes of inspiration and expiration
      ratio from 1:2 to 1:1 could improve the arterial oxygenation and respiratory mechanics in
      the patients who undergoing laparoscopic low anterior resection

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  colorectal cancer

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  obesity (BMI>35), uncontrolled hypertension, coronary artery disease, uncompensated
             cardiovascular disease, current respiratory disease, open procedure

intervention.description: in only one group chages of I:E ratio would be applied

clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Inverse Ratioventilation on Laparoscopic Low Anterior Resection

primary_outcome.description: sampling for anrterial blood from arterial cannular will be analysed 10 min after anesthetic induction, 20 min after pneummoperitoneum, 40 min after pneumoperitoneum and operation end.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Prevention
